an3.125:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Gotamaka Tree-shrine.
an3.125:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an3.125:5.1: “Mendicants, I teach based on direct knowledge, not without direct knowledge.
an3.125:5.2: I teach with reasons, not without them.
an3.125:5.3: I teach with a demonstrable basis, not without it.
an3.125:5.4: Since this is so, you should follow my advice and instruction.
an3.125:5.5: This is enough for you to feel joyful, uplifted, and happy:
an3.125:5.6: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha! The Dharma is well explained! The Saṅgha is practicing well!’”
an3.125:6.1: This is what the Buddha said.
an3.125:6.2: Uplifted, the mendicants approved of what the Buddha said.
an3.125:6.3: And while this discourse was being spoken, the galaxy shook.
